transcript:
it and did not want to," thought Pierre. "But this man knows the truth and, if he wished to, could disclose it to me." 
Pierre wished to say this to the Mason, but did not dare to. The traveler, having packed his things with his practiced hands, began fas- tening his coat. When he had finished, he turned to Bezukhov, and said in a tone of indifferent politeness: 
"Where are you going to now, my dear sir?" 
"I? . . . I'm going to Petersburg/' answered Pierre, in a childlike, hesitating voice
